metadata.title: CVE-2019-15680 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
TightVNC code version 1.3.10 contains null pointer dereference inHandleZlibBPP function, which results Denial of System (DoS). This attackappear to be exploitable via network connectivity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.12+dfsg-9ubuntu0.1
libvncserver1 - 0.9.12+dfsg-9ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.12+dfsg-9ubuntu0.1').
x11vnc package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
ssvnc package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
vncsnapshot package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
tightvnc package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
veyon package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
